text: Carolyn See (born Caroline Laws; January 13, 1934 - July 13, 2016) was an American educator and critic. She was the professor emerita of English at the University of California, Los Angeles. See was the author of ten books, including the memoir, Dreaming: Hard Luck and Good Times in America, an advice book on writing, Making a Literary Life, and the novels There Will Never Be Another You, Golden Days, and The Handyman. She was also a book critic for the Washington Post for 27 years. See died on July 13, 2016 in Santa Monica, California from cancer, aged 82. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Educators from Pasadena, California Category:American literary critics Category:Writers from Pasadena, California Category:University of California, Los Angeles faculty
title: Carolyn See
